availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Irvine, Estill County, Kentucky merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Goodwin Scholl. Father of Edward A. Scholl, Elizabeth A. Scholl and Mary E. Scholl. Occupation in 1850 constable, 1860 merchant.and 1870 teacher. Served in Co. G, 47th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.). Mustered in on October 5, 1863, mustered out on December 26, 1864, promoted to quarter master on 31 Oct 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 59B

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of KentuckyPeter D. Scholl, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 443.
